title: Sampler, 19th century
medium:
Medium: wool and cotton embroidery on linen foundation; linen needle lace
Technique: embroidered in running, double running, and satin stitches and withdrawn element work and needle lace edges on plain weave foundation
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 19.1 x 57.2 cm (7 1/2 x 22 1/2 in.)
description: Horizontal sampler divided into three columns of pattern, with withdrawn element work in white and geometric pattern bands in colored threads. Needle lace at bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 19th century.
19th century. Medium: wool and cotton embroidery on linen foundation; linen needle lace
Technique: embroidered in running, double running, and satin stitches and withdrawn element work and needle lace edges on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-407.
